title: Find Out When Election Day Is in the 2016...
text:
Updated February 23, 2016 . 
When is Election Day? 
The next presidential election date is Tuesday, Nov. 8, 2016. But there are other offices on the ballot in addition to that of president. Voters will elect members of the U.S. House of Representatives and U.S. Senate as well as a new president of the United States in the 2016 election. 
Related Story: All About Super Tuesday 2016 
The date of the federal election is always the second Tuesday in November. In the 2016 presidential election, voters also choose 34 of the 100 members of the U.S. Senate and all 435 members of U.S. House of Representatives . The political makeup of Congress will likely change. 
Congress requires elections be held on Tuesdays. In fact, elections for president, U.S House of Representatives and Senate have been held on Tuesdays since 1845 . Despite the requirements on when Election Day is to be helf, voters in about two-thirds of states are allowed to cast their ballots beforehand under "early voting" laws. 
continue reading below our video How Do Senate Elections Work? Presidential Race
